1.content:
You are Anon. It is late in the afternoon, going walking down the street by your house. Just another boring and ordinary day.

You hate it. How you'd do anything to escape the dullness of your current life and do something exciting for once. Unfortunately for you, your plea is has not gone unheard. You will get your wish. But at a cost.

You hear the loud horn of an eight-wheeler blast in the air which shouldn't have frightened you. Yet, it did. Something about that horn felt wrong, disturbing you deeply on a primal level. You turn you head to see the truck it originated from, and you entered a state of terror you previously never experienced before. The truck that had an otherworldly aura was speeding your way. You just knew instinctively that the driver, if there is one, is deadset on mowing you down.

Tried as you might, your legs can not outrun Truck-Kun, the heavenly 18-wheeler and lord of all trucks. You never had a chance. The divine Kenworth T680 catches up to you.

You wake up in a grey void where you're the only living thing in this void. This isn't the afterlife you think. You heard the horn of Truck-Kun again, and many portals open in front of you. You are tossed into one of the portals by an unseen force. What portal are you flung into?
1.title: Starting out, again

111.content: Which series are you going to be sent to? As for your deck you will always start out with a standard starter deck that befits the era you're in. It wouldn't make too much sense to have an overpowered deck with Zexal era cards in the original series. You can however change up your decks when as you go further on in the storyline.
111.title: Yu-gi-oh

choices: Flip the Script, get a big titty psychic gf
1113.content:
Your initial deck will be the starter deck from Reverse of Arcadia. But here we go with the options.
Option #1: Starting off at the Beginning: you wake up in the Satellite around the time Yusei was plotting his escape to take Stardust Dragon back from Jack.

Option #2: Flip the Script: You wake up in New Domino City before the main plot line begins around the time Sayer first meets Akiza. Maybe you can get to her before he does and be a light in Akiza's life?

Option #3: Officer Anon: You wake up and you're a new officer of Sector Security

Option #4: Mind Bullets: Once again you wake up in New Domino City before the Fortune Cup. This time you are now a psychic duelist. Unfortunately for you Sayer was snooping around, noticing you're having difficulty controlling your new powers. You'll have to endure him for a while.
1113.title: 5ds

choices: Ignore that. Figure out where you are
11134.content:
You wake up to the worst headache you've ever had before. You grab your head in pain, not that it would do any good to stop the abnormal burning sensation that envelops your brain. The pain momentarily subsides allowing you to notice a new weight on your left arm. You take a look at your arm to find a weird looking device attached to it. Wait, you've seen this thing before.

It's a duel disk from the Yugioh anime, specifically one of the standard issue ones the 5ds series. https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/yugi...

When you were younger you and your friends would stick your cards in the duel disk toys and pretend to duel as they did in the show. Good times. You don't recall a toy version of the standard 5ds duel disk ever being made, and it doesn't necessarily feel like it's a toy.

You also notice there's a deck of cards inside it. You probably need to go to a hospital on account of surviving(you think) being ran over by a truck, but for some reason you don't feel all that bad. You just have a bizarre headache.

Taking the time to go through the deck you discover they are from deck the player character from the Reverse of Arcadia game originally had before being taken away by a certain psychic duelist. This only adds to the mystery. Who runs a guy over, gives them Yugioh cards, and gives them a duel disk toy(?)? And the cards are also strange. They're not like the typical cards you buy from a pack, they look like they're from the anime.
11134.title: Mind Bullets

111341.content:
Putting the cards back into the deck holder you get off the ground to learn you're in an alleyway at night. It doesn't bode too well for you. You need to get out of here before you get mugged.

As you make your way through the alleys you find dozens of faded posters lining up on the dirty walls. A good chunk of them were about where to find duel tournaments at shady sounding locations. One in particular was about something you barely could believe. Unground turbo dueling. You shake your head in confusion, your headache returning. Turbo-dueling doesn't exist in the real world. It only exists in the fictional world of Yugioh.

You mentally laughed at dumbest idea you entertained. You were sent the Yugioh world, the 5ds era to be specific, when you got hit by the truck the way some protagonists in animes, mangas, and virtual novels get sent to fantasy worlds.

That might explain the cards and duel disk, but it's all too absurd. Your younger self would be extremely happy to be in the world of an anime you loved watching growing up, but-

You are interrupted in your train of thought when a glass bottle makes contact with your head. You feel blood slowly oozing out of the wound, and it does nothing to make your headache any better.

"Ah, shucks! He's still up!" Cackled a deranged voice.

You look over to see a trio of stereotypical thugs menacingly making their way to you. One held a lead pipe, the other held a switchblade, and the last one had another bottle in his hand. He must have been the one who threw the first one at you. The most striking characteristic about all three of them was they had yellow tattoo-like lines on their faces. The same kind criminals got in 5ds.

Fug it. You really are in 5ds! And you're about to be mugged.

You can always try what Jack did in that one flashback to scare aways those thugs after Rally. You quickly reach for your deck to take a card out, any card that looks intimidating, and pull out Strong Wing Dragon.

Yes! This will work. You flash Strong Wind Dragon in this manner https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/mspa... in an attempt to look as cool as possible before placing the card on your duel disk. The green dragon materialized as a hologram and unleashed a mighty roar which sounded more realistic than it ought to be.

This does nothing to dissuade the thugs from their goal. You fall to your knees, clenching your head in pain when the headache returns with a vengeance. What happens next wasn't predicted by either you or the thugs.

Strong Wind Dragon inhales before unleashing a blast of powerful wind at the belligerents, knocking them into the brick wall far behind them.

You have no idea what just happened other than you inflicting real damage similary to what Akiza did in the anime.

"I'm a psychic duelist?" You say out loud.

"Correct my new friend." You hear a new voice behind you say affirmatively.
111341.title: Ignore that. Figure out where you are

choices: Arriving at the Arcadia Movement and meeting Akiza
1113411.content:
With shaky legs you force yourself off the ground to take a look at this new voice behind you. It was a red haired man with a large curl in his hair, dark green eyes, and he wore a brown trench coat.

Oh great. You know this bastard all to well. It's Sayer or Divine as he was called in the Japanese version. This isn't even the presumably nicer Arc-V version of him. It's the manipulative ruthless leader of the Arcadia Movement version of him.

Since this Sayer is still alive without a scar you can only assume you are currently in the timeframe before the Dark Signers Arc. Meaning he's still pulling Akiza's strings along with other psychics he's misleading. The man's sick in the head.

Just thinking about how one moment you got hit by a truck and were sent into an anime world that revolves around a children's card game, got sent to the season that revolves around said card game on motorcycles, and became a psychic before being hit in the head with a bottle is making your headache become extremely unbearable.

"You don't seem that bad off for someone who got hit by a truck, Anon." The man says to you, his voice maintaining an illusion of friendliness.

"Could you not read my mind?" You ask bluntly. How are you going to keep anything from this guy?

"I wanted to get a vibe on you," he replies, "And it's not like I can get too much. That headache of yours plus a million jumbled thoughts running through your mind is making it difficult for me."

"But, I can tell you already know my name. And I already know your name too. No need for any lengthy introductions."

"Lucky us." You quip.

"And there's that unnecessary hostility you have for me out of nowhere."

"I got hit by a truck and took a bottle to my head on top of having my having my mind feeling like it's about to splinter into a million little pieces as my brain burns."

"Disregarding two of those, I can tell you from experience I know what you're going through, Anon." The man said sympathetically, "Having your powers awaken out of the blue can be quite painful."

You can take a not too wild guess here and say he wants you to join his little club. You tell him you accept his invitation.

Ordinarily you'd want nothing to do with this guy, you've seen what he's really like in the anime and Reverse of Arcadia. However, like it or not Sayer is the expert in controlling psychic powers. Hurting someone, probably yourself included, with your newfound abilities isn't something you want on your conscience. You'll just have to tolerate the wicked psychic before you as long as you can.

You also need a place to stay. You don't want to risk getting mugged again. Additionally, you can try your hand at flirting with Akiza and any other psychic babe you come across.

11551.content:
Since there are slight differences between the anime and manga we'll do this the way I normally do when writing Soul Eater stuff. Merge them both. For example:
1: Evil Humans and Kishin Eggs both exist as concepts. While only Lord Death and presumably Kid as a full fledged Reaper can tell the difference between a regular human soul and an evil human anyone can see the difference between a human soul, evil or otherwise, and a Kishin Egg Soul.

2: Generally speaking it really depends on the situation on what causes a person to become a Kishin Egg. Some people can either become them depending on how much madness they have within them, or if an Evil Human has further devolved until they're no longer counted as human but a monster that represents the madness of the person they once were.

3: Kishin Eggs can eat souls too just like demon weapons.

Now to the choices here.

Option #1: Student at the DWMA (Meister): you wake up as a student at the DWMA. Pretty simple.

Option #2: Student at the DWMA (Weapon): Sams as the above but Truck-Kun felt generous and granted you Demon Weapon genes.

Will you sabotage behind the scenes for the good guys, bail out the first chance you get with newfound powers, or will you somehow get Arachne to fall for you? The choice between you becoming a sorcerer or gaining some other form of supernatural powers is up to you.

Option #5: More choices

115514.content:
You finally come to after being tossed into a portal, greatly surprised you managed to survive being ran over by a truck. Though your new location is less than welcoming. As your eyes adjust to the room's lighting, not that there is much in, you find yourself on the floor that bears a red spider web pattern with dark green pillars appeared to be made from stone reaching the ceiling. You've seen this place many times before animated and drawn on a manga page. You definitely shouldn't be here. You can even hear that sensual music accompanied by French lyrics playing in your head.

You raise your head up to see that giantic spiderweb and there she is. In the center of it is the curvaceous spider witch, looking down upon you with her normally stoic expression.

You're now in the Soul Eater, the anime where people can turn into weapons and eat souls, go to an academy where the grim reaper is the headmaster, and try to keep the world safe from those who strayed off into the path of evil and witches. And you just so happened to land into the abode of the witch who's sinister as she is sexy.

You notice a lack of your mind being molested by the overwhelming presence of Asura's madness so you safely assume you are not that far into the anime. Or the manga where Arachne doesn't try to get Asura to fall in love with her but instead leaves her body to become madness which only results in Maka having an easier time killing her. This might actually be a bit of a problem when you think about it. Which version of Soul Eater ARE you in? The anime or the manga?

"Are you done gathering your thoughts, Anon?" Arachne said to you, "I can only imagine your journey here was pleasant."

How does she know about that and your name?

15411.content:
You should have died.

That was the first thought you had as you woke up in a bed, sore as all hell.

"Ah, you're awake." You heard a calm steady voice say.

You look over and almost do a double take as you see Prof. Ozpin from RWBY next to the bed. He... Shouldn't exist.

"I'm sure you have a lot of questions." He said "I have some of my own. Let's talk."

"Uhh, ok." You say "Well, I'm Anon. I have no idea whats going on. You're a fictional character, and I've probably went insane."

Ozpin lets out an amused chuckle "Well, I am Prof. Ozpin but based on what you've said you knew that. Tell me, what's your favorite fairy tail?"

"Ugh, I've heard that too many times already." You say flopping back onto the bed. "What are you gonna explain at me today?"

Ozpin not at all phased by your demeanor continued "Well, your something of an outsider to this world. Something named Truck-kun,"

You groan.

"Has sent you to our world. I've met a few people in your position, though your the only the third one to know about our world in someway."

"Oh, cool wonderful. So assuming I'm not crazy, since I can't fix that anyway, why am I here?"

"I couldn't very well leave you passed out in Grimm invested woods now could I?" Ozpin adjusted his glasses "It would appear that good deed has repaid me with someone who knows whats happening, perhaps more than I do."

"You want spoilers? Ok." you take a breath "The main character is named Ruby Rose, Leomond is betraying you and the person taking the Fall Maiden's power is Cinder Fall, she'll be here for the festival with a full team of criminals under cover."

Ozpin was silent for a second and then took out his scroll. He typed something out and looked back to you.

"That you for the warning." He said with a smile "I'll look into it."

"Please do, if you don't Ironwood goes insane." You say "Anyway, how long will I be here?"

"That depends on you." Ozpin says "If you want I can enroll you under... special circumstances into Beacon Academy."

"Yes." You said automatically, eager to live out your fantasy. (Possibly some of your dirty fantasies too.)

Ozpin smile still on his face typed on his scroll some more. "Eager I see. Well, you'll prove to be a most effective addition to our arsenal."

With that he left you in your room and you fell asleep quickly.

15412.content:
Bright sunlight falls upon your closed eyes, stirring the aching you awake. You weren't prepared for going to the afterlife today, but you suppose everyone has to die sometime. Instead seeing Saint Peter at the pearly gates your slowly opening eyes find something completely different. You find yourself lying on a paved ground in front of a statue and building you've seen from a certain web animation you have watch. You're at Beacon Academy from RWBY now.

You try to make sense out of this while you get off the ground. Your body feels different, maybe a few years younger till you're around 17, and as if you've trained for years. Not too weak, not too strong, but the middle ground. You are either having a hallucination on account your head being hit by a speeding truck, or your afterlife is a web animation with anime influences made in Texas. You're not sure what is more rational.

Then it happens. A swarm of rose petals is coming your way. You know exactly what and more importantly who it is.

Ruby, wearing her volume one outfit, resumes her usual form with open arms, embracing you in a tight hug but also knowing you back to the ground. She's hugging you. Ruby Rose from RWBY is hugging you. You can safely say for a fact you aren't dead. This is feels all too real. You're also enjoying being hugged by one of the cutest girls on the show.

"I'm so happy you can finally be here with us, big bro!" Ruby says, utterly confusing you.

Before you get a chance to even begin with her calling you that your mind is flooded with strange new memories. You couldn't decipher all of them but a few stood out. Ruby's mom Summer trying to comfort a younger you as you both stand in a ruined town, growing up with Ruby and Yang, and you struggling in what you imagine to be a training school.

This doesn't seem like the regular version of RWBY you are now kn to at all. You have watched your fair share of isekai animes, but one typically don't get sent to an already established fictional world where they get shoehorned into the lives of the characters there.

But hey, you can make this work. You wanted an exciting life, and evidently a magic truck heard your wish before granting it.

You can do a lot here armed with your knowledge of the show, and who knows what you'll do when you unlock your semblance. With so many possibilities to explore you don't know where you'll end up. However, you are certain some of those possibilities end with you getting your new sisters pregnant. And probably others.

choices: Knock first!!! (one of the girls were in there changing)
154122.content:
While the possibilities in front of you are infinite, in the here and now well.... you feel a bile rising in your stomach.

"Uh -Anon- you okay?" you lean against the courtyard statue, disgustingly swallowing back whatever you had just eaten prior. You must've just gotten here, you do get air sick and if Jaune's anything to go by that air ship probably didn't do you any favors. "Oh wow you're green, like really green. HEY! Stay with me! Don't go into the light!"

"Y-yugh.... s-sorry guess I... ate something bad..." you made up sitting at the statue base. Deep breaths, come on in and out. Oh this would be so much easier if your mind wasn't assaulted with new memories too. Closing your eyes didn't help either, it was like a film was hyper imposed against your eyelids every time you blinked. One second it's you with a little Ruby being dragged around in her wagon by Yang and Yourself. The next its you and your foster father, Tai, getting Ruby ready for beacon a year prior. It only added to nausea, and Ruby was looking more concerned seeing you like this.

"Ah boy you really need somewhere better to get sick... I know! Let me show you my room!" Ruby said, grabbing your arm and hoisting you up.

"Y-yugh Ruby wait...!" the sudden lurch almost made you spew, a slight chuckle from your new little sister was the only indication that you started being moved against your will.

"Oh quit being such a stick in the mud mr.cucumber, besides you got to meet my team and Yang definetely wants to see you." she said leading you toward the dorms. Another flash of memory when you blinked gave you the picture of a younger yang giving you a noogie with you trying to get her off by biting the arm she had you locked in.

"Anwyay, hey keep your eyes open!" ugh it hurt a little to do that, actually your head was starting to ease up a little. Ruby was leading you under a archway of some sort, near some of the classrooms with the dorms not too far away. "Like i was going to say, thats the class hall so you'll be spending alot of time there. The cafeteria is over there and..."

"Why's it got caution over the door?" you felt the need to ask. Ruby let out another chuckle just as you realized or rather guessed why that was.

"Oh yeah... haha funny story there was a big food fight a little while ago and.... long story short..." she started to let out a little embarassed yet still having that same confidence you knew her for.

"Yang blew a hole in the ceiling,": you said remembering that episode from volume 2. To which Ruby looked a little surprised

"Lucky guess... did dad tell you about that or something?" Ruby asked, you realizing that you have no idea what you should or shouldn't know.

"Um... uh... well it's Yang so..." you quickly made up. Ruby rolled her eyes before nodding

"Yeah that's true... oh speaking of which." she said as she brought you into a building "Welcome to the dorms! Your home away from home, complete with sisters!" she said no hauling you up the stairs as she went on "Youre going to love our room! We got the most space compared to the other teams because we made our beds into bunk beds and..." as she went on the thought occured to you. that food fight happened in volume 2, early volume 2. So it was clear you weren't in volume 1, though you could've pieced that together since you came to beacon after Ruby. Ever still... when were you in the timeline?

Just as you pondered it more Ruby was already at the door to their room and....
154122.title: Ruby please i need a second...

1541222.content:
"Yang! I found him!" Ruby proclaimed, then the next thing you knew there was a arm around your neck with a fist scrapping the top of your skull. You let out a sheepish yell as someone let a great fullhearted laugh.

"-Anon-!!! aw man i missed my little knuckle duster!"

"Ah ah Yang-Yang!" stomach writhing, you clenched your teeth trying to push her away before Ruby butted in.

"Woah woah woah hold it he's gonna pop!" she said managing to pull the two of you apart. Yang looked a little confused before she got a good look at your sickly shade of green.

"Oh wow, er sorry -anon-." Yang let out embarrassed. You could only let out a nod before you found your way to whichever bed seemed closest, thankfully yang's, as you held your stomach and groaned. It had gone from feeling like you wanted to throw up to just stabbing stomach pains. "Geez that looks bad"

"Yeah you're telling me, didn't even have time to go get his stuff." Ruby chimed in as you took a breath, a taste forming the tip of your tongue that you couldn't explain till Yang perked up and hurried out the door to both you and Ruby's confusion. A moment later yang returned with a big glass of... milk?

"Here dude drink up, big sister Yang has the cure for what ailes ya." she said handing you the glass. Like most things today you had no idea what this was about until your new memories started to catch up to you, Warm milk, dad's cure all, you took the glass and drank it eagerly. It did seem to help, but whether it was because of something hot going into your stomach or your brain just associating it with feeling better you couldn't tell. All you could tell is that whatever the hell had been stabbing at you had stopped, Yang let out a chuckle "Glass of milk keeps the doctor away." she said, a call back to numerous times where your dad would proclaim the same whenever you three felt Ill. For the most part it seemed to work...

"except for strep" Ruby added

"and for bee stings" you chimed in as well

"And a appendix bursting." Yang finished, a shiver going down everyone's spine. That was not a fun summer for Yang. Ruby started to crack up, probably thinking about how you would piggy back Yang around when she wanted to go outside and how she'd hit you to go faster when Ruby used her semblance to beat you guys in races. It was infectious and soon all three of you were a bunch of laughing dolts as you began to reminisce. Like the time where you and Ruby had a race to see who could climb the most trees in one day and you broke left hand as a result. Or the times that you and Yang would play action figures with Ruby and how those times would result in you two playing the real fight. Or the time mom and dad took you three to vale for a fesitival and you got lost behind a vendor but your uncle Qrow found you and...

The more time you spent talking about these new memories the more it seemed that you felt a earnest connection with them. Yes in your mind you knew the truth, they were just a couple of characters from a show you loved admittedly but still it was a fiction. Yet in this moment, You could feel in your heart that yes these were your sisters, and you loved them. The three of you spent a while talking about the past before...
1541222.title: She burns and you can't hold her back!!!

choices: A silent cool ninja girl with a bow
15412221.content: Just as Yang was finishing up a good story about the day you guys went searching in the forest by yourselves a stir came from the door. Bringing with it a...
15412221.title: somebody new? well at least to you

15414.content:
You wake up in a cave with a splitting headache. It took a moment for you to realize what happened to you. You were walking home when some crazy truck ran you over. You should have died, but now you find yourself in this dank cave.

“I died,” You muttered. “No doubt about that. This must be hell. Sounds about right.” You pinched yourself and flinched. “Okay, not a dream. So where am I?”

A glow in the distance caught your eye.

As there was no other way to go, you figured you might as well follow. The light grew warmer and you came across a stone chamber. In the middle, surrounded by 4 torches, was a pedestal with a book. You frowned and the colors of the torches caught your eye. They were four different colors, red, white, yellow, and black. Approaching the book, you jumped back as it opened up automatically and words began to appear.

Greetings human from Earth,

You have died and been reborn in the world of Remnant. This world should be familiar to you, so we can skip the explanation. The reason you were summoned was this world needs warriors. The path is up to you. Will you be a villain or hero? There are no second chances. If you die here, you die for good. To help you adjust, you will be given a weapon, skills for how to use it, and a Semblance of your choice. Be warned, Semblances cannot be all powerful and should you choose one that exceeds the limit, you will be given a random one instead. When you exit this chamber, have it in mind.

Good luck.

“What the hell?” You muttered. “I’m in RWBY?” You blinked and grin. “I’m in RWBY!” You yelled. It was one of your favorite serious and you loved the characters. Armed with some of the knowledge, you might be able to help out and even bag one of the hot girls. Glancing at the wall, you noticed a weapon. “Huh, a halberd?” You picked it up and knowledge about it flooded into your mind. “Sweet, a mechoshift one.”

It turned into two hand held axes and those axes could be high caliber pistols. The halberd also had a rifle built in. You shifted it a couple times into all forms and it felt like you’ve been doing it all your life. You practiced a few swings and it felt natural.

“This is sooooo cool!”

Glancing at the only exit that suddenly appeared, you realized you needed to think of a Semblance. You wish you had rules on what was considered ‘all powerful.’ You assumed that mean no reality warping or immortality. Thinking back to some of the anime and other shows you watched, you finally thought of an idea and stepped through to the outside world.

What Semblance did you choose?
15414.title: A fresh and clean slate

choices: Time to use your weapon for real.
154141.content:
Thousands of ideas passed through your mind. Teleportation, Mind Control, Elemental powers, but you couldn’t decide. Copying abilities was considered too, but knew you had to settle on something versatile, that was more defined. However, you were afraid whatever you chose would be too powerful and the world would give you a random useless Semblance, like detecting weather.

Finally, an idea came to mind.

You read the Seven Deadly Sins manga recently and one of the best characters, Ban, had an amazing skill that could Steal. You could use that a lot here. Not only did it steal physical abilities and items, but you also might be able to use it for other things. Semblances were supposed to evolve in Remnant. You grinned to yourself as you stepped out into the world with that in mind.

The sun greeted you and fresh air filled your lungs as you emerged from a cave on a cliff side. Enjoying the view, you almost tripped over a backpack. Looking down, you found it with some Lien, the currency of RWBY, a Scroll which was a cellphone, clothes, weird cardboard cracker things and a water bottle, and some dust vials. You had no idea how to use dust though, but your weapon used it, so you needed it.

Looking around, you saw an apply hanging from a tree about twenty feet from you. Now was a good chance to practice your Semblance. You reached out, imagining grabbing that apple and boom, it appeared in your hand.

“Sweet!” You cried out, biting into it. “So, I guess the first thing I have to do is find the city.” You looked around and realized you had no idea where to go. “How about a sign whoever is watching over me!”

A snort to your right drew your attention.

Turning, you saw what looked like a black bipedal wolf.
https://images.app.goo.gl/ZnBb9cNdrHrUg4...

A Beowolf.

“Oh shit!”

The thing was a lot more fearsome in person than in the TV show. It stood taller than you and was big and muscular. You may know how to use your weapon, but killing was something you did not have experience in.
154141.title: Steal (Roman would be proud)

choices: You meet some of Team RWBY
You meet some of Team JNPR
1541411.content:
People liked to imagine that when they get sent into another world, they can just kill monsters as easily as in a video game. That is not the case. The monsters are much more frightening then you read about or watch on a TV. Plus they bled and killing is not as easy as shows made you believe it is.

You stumbled back as the Beowolf slashed at you.

“You can do this!” You tell you self, gritting your teeth. “You have to or you’re going to die! You have the skills!” The Beowolf slashed at you and you stepped to the side, your body moving by reflex. Raising your halberd, you steadied your reserve and slashed diagonally downwards.

The Grimm was cut in half with a single blow.

Your strength must have been enhanced when you were brought over or Aura was just that impressive. The Two halves of the Grimm fell over and you collapsed to your knees. Nausea overcame you as the sight of what you just did. There was a little bit of black blood, but the body began to dissolve before a lot gushed out. They didn’t have the same organ structures as true living things did. That helped settle your stomach a little.

“I’m going to have to get use to this, aren’t I?” You muttered. A howl in the distance drew your attention. “Damn it… I don’t have a choice now.” Your hand tightened on your weapon as you saw several Beowolves and a large Bear Grimm show up.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

An Ursa.

While not as fast or agile as a Beowolf, it was much stronger physically.

A Beowolf was coming as you and you reached a hand out and focused on your Semblance. You wanted to see if you could use your Semblance to steal an arm or leg. Nothing happened. Frowning, you focused on something smaller, like an organ. If you could wipe out Grimm with just a thought, your life would be much easier. Still nothing. Growling to yourself, you imagined what Ban did in the manga and used his ability to steal power.

You suddenly felt stronger. Much stronger. The Grimm collapsed on the ground, having tripped, before continuing its pursuit of you, albeit a much slower pace.

It worked.

You can steal power from enemies just like Ban. This power was going to be perfect. The Grimm reached you and you swiped through it with your halberd again. This time, there was barely any resistance. As it died, you could feel your new power vanish instantly. Seems your Semblance only let you steal power of alive things. Looking at the other Beowolves coming as you, your halberd was quickly turned into axes and you used this fight to train.

And to get over the gore.

The last Beowolf fell with the axe firmly embedded in its skull. You were now pretty sure you were proficient enough to survive. Transforming your weapons back into a halberd, you stood before the Ursa. It changed you and you side stepped, it, slashing at it’s leg. You amputated it easily enough and it fell over. Jumping into the air, you brought your weapon down into its back, ending its life.

Taking a deep breath, you jumped off the disappearing body and looked up at the clouds.

Not it was time to find your way back to a city. You had a strong feeling to go south and that’s where you went. After traveling for about an hour…
1541411.title: Time to use your weapon for real.

choices: Ren and Nora head back to Beacon
You hang out with Ren and Nora a bit in Vale.
After splitting up, you hear something familiar.
15414112.content:
A large pink explosion caught your attention.

Realizing that couldn’t have been from a Grimm, you ran toward the noise and looked around a tree. Girl with orange hair, with top and a pink skirt wielding a giant hammer was fighting a couple Grimm.
https://images.app.goo.gl/4E8NoEhhDXBMkA...

A crater in the distance was what remained of the explosion.

“Come and get it!” Nora yelled, delivering a powerful upper cut with the hammer. It collided into the Grimm’s jaw and sent the Ursa flying. She put a hand over her eyes like a visor to watch. As she did that, a Beowolf snuck up on her and prepared to slash her.

“Watch out!” You yell, throwing an axe at the Beowolf. Nora turned around right as the axe hit the Beowolf in the back of it’s head, causing it to collapse.

“Thanks, Ren… you aren’t Ren!” Nora declared, as if you had a choice in the matter. “Unless you learned how to transform. Did you, Ren? That would be so cool.” Before you could answer, someone else did.

“No, Nora.” Ren said, stepping into view. “He’s not me.”
https://images.app.goo.gl/GAzbxx8Vkc7BCS...

“Oh, well then, thanks for the assist.” Before you could say anything, she dashed over to you and wrapped her arms around you. The bone crushing hug was even more painful than the show made it look.

“You’re welcome?” You gasped, before she finally let go of you.

“Oh, my name’s Nora.” She told you like it was an afterthought. “That’s Ren. He and I are partners at Beacon and were out here training. Are you a student too?”

“Anon,” You introduce yoru self and shake Ren’s hand. “And no. I’m not a student.”

“You’re a full fledged Hunter?!” Nora gasped.

“Haha, no.” You laughed. “I was… not available to take the entrance test, so I’ll have to wait unitl next year unless there’s some special entrance exam I can take.” You shrugged. “I was actually a little lost. I fought a pack of Beowolves and one of them tore up my map. Can you point me in the direction of Vale?”

“That way.” Ren said. “We were actually about to head back ourselves. You’re welcome to come with us.”

“That would be great, thank you.” You said, going over and picking up your axe.

“So that was awesome!” Nora told you. “You were like, Nora! I’ll save you! And threw your axe. It weaved between three trees and blew up the Grimm on contact.”

You noticed Ren looked amuse and both of you knew that didn’t happen. But this was Nora and she liked to exaggerate. You decided to play along.

“Yeah, I’m pretty good like that. Takes some practice getting the wrist motion right.” Nora laughed at your words and smacked you in the back, almost knocking you over.

“You’re awesome!” She said. “Want to be friends?”

“Sure.” You replied and looked between her and Ren. “I’m new to Vale, so any friends would be great.”

“Awesome, you should totally come with us Grimm hunting some time.” Nora said, giving you another bone breaking hug.

“Careful,” Ren warned. “Once you’re friends with Nora, there’s no going back.” He nodded at you. “But I have no issues with being friends. We can introduce you to our teammates some time.”

“You will love our fearless leader,” Nora assured you. “He cut a an Ursa Major in half with a single blow once.”

“A single blow?” You asked, interestedly.

As the three of you headed back to Vale, Nora was telling you all about her teammates. You began to get an inkling of where you were in the timeline. Forever Falls had happened, so Jaune wasn’t being bullied by Cardin anymore, but you were curious as if the battle of the docks where Black, Sun, and Ruby fought Torchwick. Or if the breach happened. You could hardly ask that and decided to let them talk. Once you were in Vale, you could use your scroll to connect to the internet and check on the time line.

You also traded numbers with Ren and Nora. They were going to be useful.
15414112.title: You meet some of Team JNPR

choices: Put your plan into action. Team RWBY will probably forgive you.
154141123.content:
You enjoyed talking to Ren and Nora. Unlike the show which only gave them limited screen time, they were real people in this world and you got to learn a bit about them. Naturally, they didn’t tell you everything about their past, but they did mention they were orphans. You told them your parents had died too, and were living on your own. That created another bond and Nora now considered you a close friend.

Once you arrived in Vale, you waved goodbye to your friends and started looking around. Being in the city was a lot different from actually watching the show. Streets were busy, humans and Faunus were mulling around, and countless stores you never knew existed were open. You sat down on a bench and began to skim the headlines in recent weeks. There was mentions of the Vytal festival, but nothing about a breach. If that had happened from the attack in Mt. Glenn, it would be everywhere.

The question was, what time had you arrived at?

You narrowed it a bit before the breach and initiation had occurred. That was still a pretty big gap. Not only that, you had limited amount of Lien. You needed to get a source of income if you wanted to survive. Based on prices of apartments and hotels, you probably could last a month, maybe two if you really ate stingy. You needed a way to either get into Beacon or make a lot of money.

“Blllllaaaaaakkkkkeeee!”

Someone was yelling and you looked up. Rounding the corner were two girls One was blonde and muscular while the other had white hair and shorter. Both were very attractive and you recognized them.

Yang Xiao-Long: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...
Weiss Schnee: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

“Blllllllaaaaaaaakkkkkeeeeee!” Yang called again. “Come on out!”

“Like yelling is going to work.” Weiss huffed, crossing her arms. “She ran from us. It’s not like she’s going to stay out in the open waiting for us to find her.”

“Maybe if you didn’t just yell at people without hearing their side of the story, she wouldn’t be in this mess.” Yang growled. “You always jump to conclusions.”

“That’s-…”

“Zip it.” Yang interrupted. “I know you have reasons, most people do. But when we find her, I am going to make her explain yourself, then you two can talk out all your differences, even if I have to lock you two in a closet until you kiss and make up. Now let’s hurry. Ruby and Penny are searching the other side of the city.”

Hah!

You now knew what your situation was. Blake had just run away from the others after they discovered she was a Faunus. That meant the attack at the docks was about to happen. If things played out like normal, Roman Torchwick would escape and there would be some explosions. Blake would meet up with her team and things would kind of work out. You could let things play out.

Or should you?

If things play out, Roman will eventually die and Cinder’s plans would work out. You couldn’t just come out and tell everyone about the situation. Was there something you could do to change things in the long run? Maybe help the main cast subdue him before things get out of hand? However, what if you could do something to solve your problems and put a cog into Cinder’s plans? You might be the bad guy at first, but this could work out.
154141123.title: After splitting up, you hear something familiar.

choices: You practice your Semblance before the docks.
You stock up on supplies before the docks.
You find a place to lay low and rest up.
1541411233.content:
You had an idea, but there were a lot of steps that still had some holes in it.

First, you had to get the rest of Team RWBY to the docks. At first, it was just Ruby and then Penny to help Blake and Sun. You need Weiss and Yang there too. Somehow you had to convince them to be there without contacting the cops. You quickly slipped into a store and got a piece of paper and then a cloak from another, making sure to keep track of where Weiss and Yang were. You quickly wrote down a message.

The Cat Faunus will be at the docks tonight. From your tone today, I assume you didn’t want the police involved. You might want to bring weapons.

That should encourage just enough interest for Yang and Weiss would have no choice to come along. Folding the paper into a plane, you carefully aimed and tossed the place before ducking into a store. You head a shout and knew you hit your mark.

“What’s in my hair!?” Yang cried out.

“Hold still a second.” Weiss scolded. “It’s a paper airplane.”

“Who threw that?!” Yang demanded, turning around and no one stepping up.

“Yang…” Weiss said slowly, after opening up the paper. “Look at this.”

You could barely see and hear them out of the window and hoped they wouldn’t notice you.

“What do you think?” Yang asked.

“They know who Blake is… so it’s a lead.” Weiss said. “We should let Ruby know.”

“If we don’t find her, we follow up on this?” Yang asked and Weiss nodded. The two of them took off and you breathed a sigh of relief. That was phase one of your plan. Roman would have a hard time fighting all four at once without an Atlas Paladin.

“Time for stage two. I don’t have much time.”

You doubt you could improve your combat skills ahead of time. You would have to rely on your current weapon skills. You could practice using your Semblance though. A couple hours of heavy practice might come in handy. You also had Lien, so shopping for supplies to enact your plan might be required. Of course, it would be a long night, so you might want to think about getting some rest.
1541411233.title: Put your plan into action. Team RWBY will proba...

choices: You make an impression. (Not necessarily a good one)
15414112331.content:
You yawned.

Hiding at the docks was not fun. It was uncomfortable and it wasn’t like you set up some pillows and blankets to cover the cold hard ground. You were also tired, as you spent most of the day practicing your Semblance. Out of everything you could improve, that was the one that could be tested the fastest. Since you could steal items from a distance, even if people were holding them, you figured it would give you a chance to change the tide of battle. People wouldn’t expect for you to suddenly wield their weapons.

Then you had to get to the docks early. You didn’t know exactly when Roman Torchwick would arrive with the White Fang and you couldn’t afford to miss it. You had exactly one shot. Finally, after almost two hours of waiting, you saw Roman Torchwick arrive with the White Fang.
https://images.app.goo.gl/kz1d78mSFUgSqo...

“Brothers and sisters of the White Fang…!” A girl shouted, putting a sword against Roman’s neck.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

“About time.” You muttered.

There was Blake, giving her speech about the White Fang and them now working for Roman. You knew it wasn’t going to work and waited. After Roman broke free, the fight started and she was helped by a monkey Faunus you knew was named, Sun.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

This is when things began to change do to your influence

“Blake!” A young girl called out and in a flash, several White Fang were knocked away as a girl in a red cape and gothic style dress appeared, wielding an enormous scythe.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/rwby...

Ruby Rose, the main heroine of RWBY.

“Ruby?” Blake gasped. “How?”

“She’s not alone.” Yang yelled jumping into the fray. “You are in so much trouble!”

“Yang?” Blake gasped.

“We are going to have a long talk when we get back.” Weiss said, creating several glyphs and sending White Fang flying. “You had us all worried sick.”

“…Weiss.” Blake muttered weakly.

“We have to talk.” Weiss said again. “But after this. I… want to hear your side of the story.” Blake blinked and looked surprised.

“What the hell is this?” Roman demanded. “A high school reunion? Shouldn’t it be past your bedtime kids?” He looked around at his troops all falling one after another. “They’re brats. What the hell is wrong with your animals? Get up and fight.”

“I’m going to enjoy this.” Yang said, slamming her fists together.

You suddenly knew you had to intervene. You ran out of your hiding spot and pulled out your halberd as she closed in on Roman. Out of the corner of his eye, he saw you approach. Grinning, he stepped back. In a way, you were really impressed. He could tell you were not on their side.

“Yang, to your right!” Blake yelled.

Yang was able to see you coming just in time and raised her guard as you hit her with a horizontal cleave with your halberd. Her aura absorbed the damage, but the force sent her flying back.

“Who’s that?” Ruby cried, holding her weapon up. Yang sprung to her feet and prepared herself for a follow up attack that never came from you. Blake and Weiss ran up and lined up with their teammates.

You didn’t look friendly after all. With your brown cloak covering most of your body and hair, you also had a makeshift mask to cover your face. It closer resembled a certain bandit leader over the White Fang and gave a distinct impression. You glanced over at Roman.

“Hey, I take it you didn’t help me for no reason.” He said conversationally.

“Wandering mercenary looking for some work that pays well,” You reply. “I don’t suppose you would be interested in hiring my service?”

“You had a good initial impression.” Roman said. “Tell you what. I got some transportation about to arrive, you keep me from being captured and you’re hired, along with a hefty sign in bonus.”

“That’s fine. You won’t be disappointed.”

You stepped forward and put your Halberd on your back.

“He’s up to something.” Weiss warned. “Don’t let your guard down.”

If they only knew.
15414112331.title: You practice your Semblance before the docks.

choices: You are taken to a WHite Fang hideout.
You and Roman are dropped off.
Roman has to meet Cinder and you are allowed to come along.
154141123313.content:
Well, might as well go big.

They were going to hate you.

You were also going to add insult to injury as you pulled out your Scroll.

“What is he doing?” Blake asked.

“Getting a good shot before you cry.” You tell them and reached out your free hand. You knew what you were taking form them and you needed to concentrate. It was a very small, but important item. “Try to smile for the camera.”

“He’s lost it.” Yang told the others. “Let’s get…”

Before she finished the sentence, you swiped your hand horizontally and then pocketed the bundle in your pocket before they could see it. None of them noticed and you couldn’t see any major changes either. Yet you had the objects, so it should work. It had to work or you were in trouble. A quick prayer was in order. Your Scroll was still being held up, as you couldn’t show weakness.

“…them!”

“Yeah!” Ruby agreed.

The four of them started forward…

That proved to be a terrible mistake.

You were soooooo glad you had your Scroll on record mode.

What you had in your pocket was countless tiny strips of clothes. Your Semblance let you instantly take something from a distance into your hand. You couldn’t pull physical things from people or Grimm, like appendages or organs, which you were kind of glad for. You could steal streangth, but only part of it. The exact limits were still unknown, but you didn’t have time to practice. Because of this, you went for the nice easy option of the least amount you had to steal, but would also not hurt Team RWBY. Not physically at least. Mental scars might remain since you took all the threat holding their clothes together.

That’s why as they stepped forward, their clothes literally fell apart off their bodies, leaving them nude.

There was a pause as they all looked down at themselves.

“KYYYYYYYYYYYYYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!”

The scream was heard all over the docks. Roman’s mouth was open in shock as you turned around and looked at him.

“Time to go.” You tell him as you put your Scroll away. “Why they are distracted.” That snapped him back to reality.

“This way, kid.” Roman dashed off and you followed, the girls too mortified to follow. “What the hell was that?”

“Humiliation, delay tactic, and future blackmail material,” You replied. “Easiest way to get out of this since the cops are sure to show up soon.”

“You definitely earned a bonus,” Roman stated. “Your suspicious timing though remains in question.”

“Yeah, well, I came to make sure you don’t die.” You tell him. “Keep up this work and that flame bitch is going to get you killed.” You really hoped he understood that code.

From his darkening expression, he did.

“We are going to talk privately.” He told you. This was not a request.

“I have so much information you will love. You and Neo.”

You both stopped talking as you approached some Bullheads on the docks, White Fang loading up a large crate.

“We are heading out, boys!” Roman declared. “Got some brats and cops on their way. Move, move, move!”

And you followed him, ignoring the looks from the White Fang members. You were too busy thinking about what was going to happen to you if Team RWBY found you. There was also how much you could tell Roman without altering the future in a way you couldn’t predict.
154141123313.title: You make an impression. (Not necessarily a good...

choices: Give him a detail run down.
Create an edited version to avoid changing too much at once.
Grimm interrupt your meeting before you can tell him.
1541411233132.content:
“Who’s the kid?” A white Fang member asked Roman, as you sat across from him on the Bullhead.

“New bodyguard I hired, since you men couldn’t even handle a couple of brats,” Roman replied, pulling out a cigar and lightning it. “We could only get some of the dust thanks to them. Drop us off at the usual spot and take the Dust to the drop off point.”

“Can he be trusted?”

You looked up.

“Well, I’m free because of him and not you, sooooo…” He trailed off and smoked his cigar. “This was way too risky, even if the payoff was big. Why the hell were the kids there?”

No one else could answer and you chose not to. The Bullhead landed outside of Vale for a fraction of a second to let you and Roman off, before flying off into the distance. Roman looked at you and snapped his fingers.

The next moment a sharp pain hit you in the back of the head as you slammed into the ground.

“Okay, kid.” Roman said, as you felt a piece of cold steal ppress against you neck. “You will tell me everything you know, why you were at the docks, and what your goal is or my associate is going to run through.”

“Neo?” You gasped, as your vision was still swimming due to the blow. The weight on your back shifted slightly.

“No idea how he knows about you,” Roman said to the person on your back. “He knows about Cinder too, so that’s why I didn’t want you to kill him.”

The snap was a signal and there was something else for a killing blow.

“You going to talk, or what?” Roman asked you.

“I told you, my goal is to keep you alive,” You gasped. “If you continue this route with Cinder, you’re going to get killed.”

“And you know this how?” Roman chuckled. “You from the future?”

“Kind of?”

There was a pause.

“Okay, let’s say I believe you,” Roman continued. “What’s the Dust being stolen used for?”

“Mt. Glenn underground railroad to blow a hole into Vale to let the Grimm in.” You answer.

There was another pause and you wished you could see his face. Your face was currently being pressed into the ground.

“How do I die?”

You could hear curiosity.

“After Cinder attacks the Vytal festival with the White Fang, you’re eaten by a Grimm,” You tell him, avoiding some of the more specific details. “Cinder then convinces Neo it was someone else’s fault and uses her as an attack dog to steal her true objective.”

“What is her objective?” Roman asked. “Isn’t it to disrupt the festival and destroy Vale?”

You laugh.

“No, her boss wants to destroy everything and she needs a certain relic Ozpin is hiding.”

The weight on your back lifted off you and you were able to stand up. Behind you, a diminutive, yet mute, white, pink, and brown girl stood, watching you.
https://images.app.goo.gl/cDEC5XvY9h5yNX...

“Let’s hear more of this.” Roman said. “You obviously know enough to at least listen.”

The question for you now was how much information could you give?

15414112331322.content:
“So let me get this straight,’ Roman sighed. “The reason Cinder is all powerful is because she has this Fall Maiden power that lets her control fire?”

“Well, half of the power,” You correct him. “The other half belongs to a girl hidden at Beacon. Also, Maidens can control more than just one element, they can control multiple. They just settle one an element they like. Looking at her name, you can tell. Her actual Semblance is Glass Manipulation. Conjure blades and things.”

“I’ve seen that.” Roman admitted and rubbed his chin. “She wants the other half of the maiden’s power and a relic at Beacon. So much so she’s going to throw all of Vale into disarray with Grimm and collapse the kingdom to get it.”

“Yep.” You confirmed. “You are expendable to her.”

“Preaching to the choir, boy.” Roman took out a cigar and started smoking. “I have a meeting with her tomorrow. Shit.”

“Surprised it only took this long to convince you,” You admit. “I figured it would take a while.”

“Kid, I’ve seen a lot of strange shit and you filled in gaps I was missing.” Roman eyed him. “I still don’t fully trust you. There doesn’t seem a reason for you to keep my alive.”

“It’s mostly for Neo,” You joked and she tilted her head and then smirked. “Seriously though, it’s cause you’re needed. Someone with your resourcefulness and thinking outside of the box is going to come in handy against Cinder and her allies.”

‘If all three of us attacked her, do you think we could win?” He asked.

“Not a chance.”

Neo and Roman stared at you.

“Listen, I’m average at best with my weapon and it’s only cause of my Semblance I can do what I do.” You reached forward toward a rock in the distance and it appeared in your hand. “You can appreciate it. My ability is Steal. If I can see it, I can take it. Weapons, rocks, threads typing clothes together…”

“Ah, that’s what you did.” Roman commented and Neo looked confused.

“Here.” You tossed her your scroll and she played it. A moment later, she fell over laughing. “Thought you would enjoy that.’ You turned back to Roman. “Can steal body parts or organs though on a living thing, otherwise I could assassinate her.”

“So there’s nothing we can do.” Roman sighed.

“Never said that, I said if we fight her, we would lose.” You corrected him. “You’re an elite criminal. I assumed you had some plan where we take her out by cheating.”

Roman laughed.

“I like this kid, Neo. What do you think?”

Neo gave a thumbs up.

“Okay kid, we have to meet her tomorrow night and explain why we failed to get all the dust. She probably knows about you by now from the White Fang, so you and Neo will tag along. After that, we can decide on our next course of action.”

You gulped.

Cinder was incredibly hot, but extremely deadly. One wrong move and you would die in a fire.

154141123313221.content:
“Well, kid.” Roman said, as the three of you arrived at one of his undoubtedly many safe houses. “Home sweet home.”

Neo pointed to herself and then to you. You weren’t sure what she was telling Roman, but you felt like it was bad for you.

“Nah, let the kid rest up. We have some more talking to do.” Roman turned to you and offered you a cup of coffee.

“Thanks.” You replied and took it. Not that you really liked coffee, but you could drink it with sugar and cream. “I take it you have other idea instead of having me meet Cinder and her team.”

“See!” Roman gestured to you while looking at Neo. “Most of the idiots we work with couldn’t even get that much.” Neo nodded and he turned to you. “Pretty much. You indicated you want to avoid changing things too much from what she’s planning, so she doesn’t act outside of your predictions.” You nod your head in agreement. “So, I had a couple of ideas, but I want to hear yours.”

“On how we survive?” You asked.

“You know it.”

“Well, we could try an assassination attempt,” You admit. “That will end her and stop all of her plans, but her associates wouldn’t take this lying down. Someone else would show up. They might leave you alone, if you want to risk it.”

“Yeah, that’s not going to happen. I’m not risking my life on a maybe.”

“Then we could just go along with her plan,” You continue. “If we meet her, I’ll either pass her inspection or die to her fire. Then you could risk your life with things to come.”

“Not a good option for either of us. Risky, but if you are allowed in the plan, it might help at the end.”

“I have one other idea,” You admit. “But you’ll have to be the one to do the talking. You can spin it the right way.”

“Oh?” He looked interested. “Go on.”

“We go to Ozpin at Beacon.”

His cup slammed down on the table.

“You nuts, kid? Ozpin?! You do remember who I am?”

“We know enough about the situation that he won’t have a choice but to listen to us,” You remind him. “He’ll listen to us neutrally. We might be able to convince him to let us stay. Or at least me. This way, I can monitor Cinder’s group from that side. We feed each other information for survival. However, I’m not sure I can explain the situation in a way that would exude confidence.”

“Hmm.” Roman glanced at Neo. “All ideas have risk and merits.”

1551155.title: Spitballing out of control here

15512.content:
You were moments away from being tossed into a grey portal by the unknown force only to side a few mere inches from the tear into reality. You are then tossed backwards by the same unseeable hands. You turn your head around to see a new golden portal shining brightly with its glory in this dark void. It is also where the unseen hands are throwing you.

You awaken by the sound of an eighteen wheeler on the move, and look up to see the ceiling of a truck trailer despite the darkness. Was all the portal thing just someone drugging you? Whoever hit you with their truck and kidnapped you is going to have Hell to pay the moment you get your hands on a phone.

That is when it happened.

A golden light suddenly illuminated the trailer, washing you over with the greatest warmth you have ever felt. You covered your eyes with an arm as the brightness was too much for you, yet you couldn't escape the light. You hear a booming laugh echo throughout the trailer that rang in your ears. It echoed for what seemed to be forever. You moved down your eyes' shield to see the shape of a figure emerging in the light. Even with the light you could tell the figure possessed a physique of an idealized Roman deity. You felt small by this imposing figure, and in the back of your head you know this was no mere man. He was more than a man.

Your lips tremble as the words escaped your mouth. "A-Are you God?"

"Haha, no." The figure dismissed casually, his chuckle as warm as the light that shines. "I go by many names in the myriad of existences," he says as the light dims down ever so slowly. "But you may call me Trucker-Buddha!" He introduced himself in a rich baritone.

The light vanished revealing the man who calls himself "Trucker-Buddha" wearing a white satin robe with red trim at the end and neck over his muscled body. His face resembled that of a certain blue-collar comedian. "I found this form to be most pleasing to you."

You questioned yourself over how an idealized form of Larry the Cable Guy was pleasing to you.

"Now arise, Anon. We have to discuss your future."

Trucker-Buddha snapped his wizen fingers and finely crafted wooden table manifested. He sat crossed leg and you followed suit as it appeared he expected you to do the same.

"Am I dead?" Was the first you thing you blurted out without second thought.

Trucker-Buddha shaked his head dismissively. "No, my friend. You are not dead. You have been chosen to be much more."

Your eyebrows raised intrigued. "Chosen?"

"I am the avatar of the one known as Truck-Kun, the 18-wheeled Ferryman. My lord normally selects an individual and whisks them away to other worlds if the world needs a great hero," the trucker fabius explains while your head still aches from being mowed down by the truck king.

Some way of being chosen.

"But within you I see something a unique quality," he says, his gaze peering into your soul, chills running down your spine. "You have the qualities needed to become what me and my lord call a Worldwalker."

"A world what?" You reply confused.

"A Worldwalker, Anon. You will have the ability to slip between the veils of realities, and traverse through all worlds. Many of these worlds are the fictional worlds you have grown to know and love."

You became incredibly interested at the sound of those words. Ever since you were a kid and a young teen you wished you could hangout with your favorite characters and to see those worlds with your own eyes. This sounds like a dream come true. However, the rational portion of your brain chimed in saying there is a catch. And the next few words out of Trucker-Buddha's mouth confirmed it.

"Before you can go run along and explore all these realities, you must perform a few tasks for me and my lord."

You kept your eyes locked with his and asked, "What kind of tasks?"

"First and foremost, hunting down monsters called Glitches." He waved his hand and the image of a creature of medium height, monotone grey, white, and black colored, and triangular spikes all over it. "They emerge when an error in the fabric of a universe occurs. Some among their ranks are those my lord even sent to said universe they manifest in."

This all sounds similar to the Heartless from Kingdom Hearts. You make a mental note to play it cool when you encounter Sora and his friends so you don't get sued.

"I guess I'll take it." You shrug. Being a multi-universal cleanup man/errand boy sounds better than your prospects back at home.

Trucker-Buddha shakes his head before telling you one of the perks this job. "I know that there are many of the fairer sex that you have fantasized over, Anon. You may take as many as you desire as your own." Now that got your attention. The thought of turning the entire female cast of fictional settings into your harem girls was enough to be an errand boy worth it.

"Okay, so, how do I travel to universe to universe? I don't have to be ran over by your boss again do I?"

Trucker-Buddha laughed in reply, his hearty laugh once again echoing throughout the trailer. "The ability to traverse between the realities will is one of many gifts I shall grant you. Once all the glitches in an area has been slain their energy will open a portal for you."

Gifts? What else does he have for you?

"The next gift is to make the appearance of women on the monstrous side appear normal less they bring unwanted attention when you bring them to tag along with you."

That one makes sense. You can't have monstergirls looking like monsters in settings they don't belong in.

Images of different worlds appear in front of you.

As you examined them your memory connected the dot. These are Garry's Mod maps with one being minecraft map.

"These are your third gift. Different worlds for you to relax when you are not exploring and fighting glitches. I have also taken into account you may go overboard with your collection of beauties and require a considerable amount of space." Trucker-Buddha was right about that. Knowing you, you'll end up turning several thousand anime girls into your sex slaves. He then made three more images of worlds for you to look at. The first was what appeared to be an ancient cathedral https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/f... you were in awe of its majesty. The 2nd was a farmhouse https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/f... that you found to be rather comfy looking. You probably aren't going to use that one much at all.
