155121.content:
So you have been chosen to be a multi-universal cleanup man by a godly truck, given the ability to travel to different worlds once you kill monsters who might have been other people isekai'd, the ability to make monstergirls look like regular girls, and multiple worlds to be your relaxing areas and to house your harem girls. What will the final gift be?

"I will allow you to pick the final gift, Anon." Said Trucker-Buddha, "But it must be something for you to survive in the different realities. While you may pick up certain powers in these worlds, becoming a psychic or learning magical spells, they work differently in certain worlds. They make be weaker, stronger, or might not even work at all."

You had to think about that. Some of the fictional worlds you like have people shooting fire and lasers out of their hands, psychic powers, and many other fantastical abilities. You're going to need something to match that if you get into a fight.

"May I recommend the Gift of Absorption? By touching a native of a certain universe you gain their abilities albeit weaker," Trucker-Buddha proposed.

*Note that as you kill more glitches and become more experience at this you can get new places to chill out. Make your own hangout like a mansion or something.
155121.title: The final gift

choices: It was a Video game world
1551211.content:
“Absorption sounds fun,” You admit. “But limited. Can I have Absorption and Fusion? I’ve seen a lot of interesting things online with those powers.”

“Hmm,” Trucker-Buddha considered, rubbing his chin. “I suppose that would be acceptable.” He grinned. “Your mind tells me you know a lot about this type of thing. Your skills will develop over time and start off weak.”

“I figured as much,” You sighed. “Hoped otherwise, but I understand.”

“Good,” Trucker-Buddha laughed. “I’ll grant you your abilities. Now, to see their status and description of what you have learned, say, ‘Status’.”

“Status!” You said.

A box in midair in front of you opened up.

Status: Anon

Health: 100%
Mana: 100%

Abilities:

Absorption (Nonliving) Level 1: Touching an item will allow you to absorb it’s properties. Example: Touching Iron with your hand will make your hand like Iron. Longer the contact, further it spreads. Small quantity of material can only change so much. Higher levels spell increases absorption speed and requires less material.

Fusion: (Living) Level 1: Allows you to fuse yourself with another living being. This requires ten minutes of direct contact and concentration, or Fusion will not work. High levels will speed up the time required for a fusion. Higher levels will also allow you to adjust the fused state to keep certain attributes of who you fused with. Max level will let you look exactly like the fused target if you prefer. Warning: If opponent is significantly mentally stronger than you, they may take over the fusion until you defuse.

You didn’t like the last sentence very much, but fusing was kind of risky. As long as you didn’t try to fuse with the big bad evil guy of worlds, you would probably be okay. Absorption was going to be useful. Touch a large surface of metal to make your entire body nearly indestructible. Will be useful against glitches. You wondered if you managed to catch a bird for ten minutes at higher levels, could you fuse with it and just keep the wings?

Something to try down the road.

“Looks good,” You admit. “So when can I start finding girls?”

Trucker-Buddha laughed.

“For every glitch you defeat, you can take one girl from another world,” He told you. “When glitches are beaten, they release a lot of energy, which divides into two things. It creates experience for you and will allow you to bring a girl from their world. To prevent worlds form unbalancing after you take someone out, the enrgy creates a copy of them to keep the universe going. In essence, you get the original and a clone remains. Just in case you have to go back.”

“And the girls are okay with this?” You asked.

“You have to convince them to come, willingly, forcefully, or brainwashing.” Trucker-Buddha told you. “Now, the first world I’m going to send you to. It’s a very simple world with a very easy glitch. Think of it as a freebie to test everything.”

A portal opened up.

“After that, you’re on your own. A phone will be provided with information to help you get around.”

“I’m ready!” You said excitedly and stepped though into the familiar area. He was right, it’s a very popular location you recognized immediately.
1551211.title: The Gift of Absorption

15512111.content:
You had arrived in a field near a road with a forest off in the distance. A sign pointing to a place called Viridian City.

That alone was enough to tell where you were. You didn’t even have to glance at the familiar animals all around you.

The Pokémon world, more importantly, Kanto, the place it all started.

“Holy shit!” You gasped. “I’m actually here!”

You looked down at yourself and admired your new world clothes. Typical sweatshirt and jeans, with decent shoes. There was also a bag on the ground and you picked it up. Inside you found trail food and water, along with a smart phone. You opened it up and red the message.

First Mission Details:

When Ash Ketchum was united with his Pikachu, he started a journey that stretched over countless lands, video games, books, and shows in your world. That has not happened yet in this world. Soon, the renowned Professor Oak will run into Pikachu and bring it back to his lab. The glitch you are looking for is going to interfere with that event. If it does, the entire future of this world will change. When changed forcefully by a glitch that should not exist, the world itself will start to unravel.

Your mission is to defeat the glitch and make sure Pikachu and Professor oak meet.

The bag you are carrying will always have food and water. The food is only for survivability and is not top class dishes. If you want those, you need to shop in the world you’re at or have a girl in your base who can cook. There will also be a little money for traveling expenses and necessities. You won’t be able to buy a mansion with it, so don’t try. The phone will work in all universes and won’t draw attention. Once you complete this mission, you will be able to travel to a dimension of your choice and work on getting a girl to join you.

There was no Pokeballs in the bag, which actually disappointed you for a minute.

“Well, I guess I know what my mission is now,” You sighed. “Never saw the prequel movie so I don’t know much except Pikachu was in Viridian forest. That has to be the forest.” She sat on a rock and thought to yourself. “No idea what the glitch looks like, but I bet it’s obvious. That leaves me a couple options. One, look around for more information, or two, start practicing using my new powers. If I can’t beat the glitch, it doesn’t matter if I find it.”

Absorption would let him absorb the traits of nonliving objects like the rock you were sitting on, metal, or other similar items. Maybe trees if nonliving meant inanimate with your powers. That would be something to try. The next one was Fusion, which would require another living participant. You WERE in a world of Pokémon so fusing with one of them would give you powers and probably some weird monster hybrid form. The difficulty was finding a Pokémon or something else that would let you hold them for 10 mins.

What are you going to do?
15512111.title: It was the Pokemon World.

155121112.content:
“Might as well start off with something easy then work my way up,” You decided. “Last thing I want is to accidentally fuse with something and can’t defuse. That would be terrible… and awkward… and terrible. Status!”

The box in midair opened up for you to review.

“Just need to touch it?” You stood up and touched the rock you had been sitting on. Nothing happened. “Wow, glad I decided to practice. Let’s concentrate I guess?” You imagined the rock flowing into your arm.”

Then you felt a tickling sensation.

Your eyes widened as your fingers turned grey like the rock and the color continued up your arm. The more you concentrated, the more it flowed up your arm. When the color reached your shoulder you pulled your hand back and gaped at it. The rock you had been sitting on was slightly smaller, as you absorbed the material into your arm. Your were able to flex your arm and fingers without issue. Yet when you touched it with your other arm, it felt like stone.

“This is crazy!” You gasped. Turning around, you walked up to a lone tree. Gritting your teeth, you brought your arm back and punched the tree. A shock rippled through the trunk and the leaves rustled. You found out your hand didn’t hurt at all. It really was stone. “This is so awesome!” You raised your stone fist into the air and laughed. “Now, how do I defuse?”

You concentrated and the color began to recede. Instead of dripping or falling out, it just vanished. Then you eyed the rock and saw the material you had absorbed returned to the rock. You rushed over to it and touched the smooth stone. No cracks or seams were in the surface.

“So after I get rid of what I absorb, it goes back to what I took the stuff from,” You muttered. “Handy.” You touched the tree and concentrated. Your hand became bark like in structure, but when you tried to absorb leaves, it didn’t work. “So there are rules, good to know. I should carry a metal bar or something around in my bag for emergencies.”

You defused and looked around. Now that you had a chance to enjoy the scene, you recognized some of the Pokémon. This was the starter area, so there were only really basic Pokémon. It had been years since you played or watched the original games and shows, but you knew some of the iconic ones.

There were several of the purple and white rat Pokémon: Rattata
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/poke...

There was also a flock of the brown and tan Pokémon: Pidgey
https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/a/ae/...

They could be friendly and one might be willing to let you hold it for 10 mins. There was a little risk involved, but it was the only way to really test out your fusion power.

Though, you could keep looking around to find something else.
155121112.title: Practice your Absorption power

choices: You and the Pokemon slowly merged.
A light originated from your touch and slowly covered both of you.
Before the ten minutes passed, something caused you to lose contact.
1551211122.content:
The temptation of being able to fly was too much. Everyone dreamed of being able to fly at some point. All the Pidgeys nearby attracted your attention immediately. The question was how could you get near without them attacking or flying away.

You had to try.

You threw your backpack over your shoulder and walked around until you saw a flock of Pidgey’s on the ground, pecking at the grass. Slowly, you walked forward, trying not to act threatening. A couple of the Pokémon looked up at you as your approached, tilting their heads curiously.

“Easy there,” You whispered. “I’m not a bad guy. I’m just want to be friends.”

When you got within a couple steps of one of the birds, it hopped away.

“Please?” You were nearly begging. “I just want to touch you for a bit.”

After those words escaped your mouth, you realized how bad they sounded. The Pidgey’s recognized your words too and the next thing that happened was them flapping their wings, sending a small tornado at you. The force of the Gust attack sent you flying back as the birds took off.

“Crap…” You sighed. “Do I have to go to Pallet Town and get a starter Pokémon?”

Sighing to yourself, you sat down on the rock and pulled our some trail mix from your bag. Popping a few pieces into your mouth, you pondered what to do. A couple minutes of thinking with no success, a shadow passed over you and something landed a few feet away. Looking up, you saw a Pidgey staring at you.

Well, it was staring at your food.

“Do… Do you want some?” You asked, holding out a few pieces.

A happy caw came from the Pokémon and it flapped it’s wings excitedly. It’s beak picked a few pieces of granola from your hand and chowed down.

“Heh, you’re pretty nice,” You mused. “The other Pidgey’s don’t like me. I’m new to all this and I just happen to like Pokémon. Want to hold one for a bit is all.”

The Pidgey tilted its head. Then, without warning, it hopped into your lap and settled down. Surprised at the action, you almost fell back but caught yourself. The Pidgey looked up at you and you swore that it was asking if you felt better. Nothing much you could do but nod and present it more food to keep it happy. It let you pet it’s back and rest an arm around it.

It was now or never to try a fusion. You weren’t sure if this was a male or female Pokémon, but honestly, it didn’t matter. It was your only option at the moment. It will be a surprise for you. You also had no idea how the fusion process was going to work. Would it absorb the bird through your touch or will you melt together?

This is why you were going to practice.

You concentrated on fusing with the Pidgey.
1551211122.title: Try to befriend a Pidgey

choices: You didn't see anything and just enjoyed the flightl.
15512111222.content:
You notice a soft light emerging from your hand where you were touching the back of the Pidgey. It slowly climbed up your arm and spread to the feathers of the Pokémon. Warmth followed the glow. It was a pleasant feeling and you continued to concentrate. The Pidgey noticed the warmth and looked around, eyeing the glow, but didn’t do anything to get away. You gave it some more food with your free hand to keep it calm. The glow wasn’t super bright, so it wasn’t startling. Like a glow stick during the day. Noticeable, but unless it was night, easy to overlook.

Ten minutes.

That’s how long it took for the glow to completely engulf both of your bodies.

At that point, things got fuzzy and your body felt hot. Things moved that shouldn’t have moved and you felt like a liquid. The weight in your lap vanished as the Pidgey merged with your body. Neither of you could do anything even if you wanted to. The ability had activated and you two were now combining. The feathers grew from your body and your clothes alternated to accompany your new body. Your eyes had a hard time seeing all the changes until it was done.

You were sitting down, alone, the Pidgey gone.

However, your body was completely different.

Your feat had shows that only covered the top of your feet, which now resembled bird talons. Your pants still existed and covered your lower half, but it seemed thinner and shorter. Your height shrunk because the Pidgey was much smaller than you. Your arms were now brown feathery wings with no hands. Your chest was devoid of your hoodie, but covered in tan feathers. However, you noticed something differnet you wouldn’t expect even if you fused before.

You had a pair of breasts on your chest.

The Pidgey had been a female. Maybe that’s why it was willing to cheer you up. You fused with a female Pokémon and now had a female body. You check your pants by pulling it open with the tip of your wing. Yep, a girl. You looked around in a slight panic and hopped over to a nearby pond. Looking at your reflection, you saw your face, which was pretty similar with some large eyebrow feathers.

At least you didn’t have a beak, though your hair resembled Pidgey a bit now.

All in all, you looked like a Harpy. Which, thinking about it, made sense as you fused a bird and a human.

You felt a slightly headache as another consciousness in your head collided with yours. The Pidgey was in your mind too and both of you were sharing the body. Since you initiated the power, you had initial control, but the Pidgey was panicking. You could feel like you could suppress it, but decided on a gentler response.

I’m sorry! This power of mine let me merge with you. I need to find something evil in this area and stop it before it hurts everyone. I swear I’ll defuse us.

The Pidgey’s mind relaxed as it understood. Your mind was then flooded with Pidgey’s memories and skills it had. It seemed working with them had it’s uses. If you forcefully suppressed its mind, would it tire you out? The Pidgey currently knew Gust and Sand Attack. It was a young Pokémon in the starting area.

Now that the fusion was over, you had to try out your new body. No humans were around to bother you, so you spread out your new wings, flapped them, and took off into the sky.
15512111222.title: A light originated from your touch and slowly c...

choices: Head to the forest to avoid confrontation.
155121112223.content:
This was amazing!

You were so high up in the sky and everything looks so small and insignificant. The wind riffled your new feathers and cooled you off under the bright sun. Flying was so great that it even distracted you from your female body. For now, you were getting used to moving and fighting in your temporary half bird body. For fun, you went extra high and then dove, before pulling yourself up at the last second and your talons brushed the grass.

Pidgey’s mind and instinct help you with the timing.

It was worth the ten minutes of cuddling to get this. You could feel the Pidgey in the back of your mind, but it was sort of muffled. It gave up control so you didn’t have to worry about it fighting your choices. After getting used to flying, you began to circle around, looking for any clues on what to do. You actually flew past a flock of Pidgey’s and they didn’t seem to mind you. Maybe you smelled close enough like them now? Whatever the reason, you flew around with them a bit.

Eventually, you parted ways and swooped down to pick up your bag with your talons.

“Nothing seemed out of the ordinary,” You sighed. “Not sure what I was expecting. Smoke from the forest? A giant dead zone? Anything?” You sighed again loudly and stretched, your hands touching your feather chest. A shock of pleasure went through your body. “No, bad. This can be later, right now, focus!” Your snacked your cheeks with the tip of your wings.

Even if you had a girl harpy body, there was a time and place for everything.

“I need to figure out what I have to do.” You muttered. “Where am I supposed to go? The forest or town are really only nearby locations.” You looked down at yourself. “Probably shouldn’t go into town like this so I can check out the forest first I guess?”

“What then-…?!”

You jumped and spun around. An older man with hiking clothes was staring at you in shock.

“Umm… hi?” You replied awkwardly.

“It can talk!” The man cried out. “Monster!” He turned and ran. “That’s no Pokémon!”

“Shit…” You muttered. What did you do now?”
155121112223.title: Someone saw you.

1551211122232.content:
You were not being paid enough for this.

Well, a harem was the payment, so you were, but you didn’t feel the need to explain yourself to every random hiker in this world. You flapped your wings and took off, your bag in your talons. Besides the town, which you couldn’t go in your fused body, there was only the forest. Pikachu was supposed to be from there and you needed to find him. The glitch was after that poor mouse and your job was to protect it.

You flew over the tree tops, looking around. You saw a lot of bug and plant Pokémon. Seeing all the Pokémon you grew up memorizing was crazy, but a once in a life time experience. Though, it was dangerous too. You had to avoid a hive of Beedrills, giant bee Pokémon, or risk being attacked. The forest was dense, but not completely covered. There were gaps for you to see everything as you flew over.

The Pidgey in your mind began to tell you something. It couldn’t talk, but you understood. It knew what you were looking for and it noticed the yellow mouse running along the forest floor.
https://images.app.goo.gl/9GZPcdLd9Uj4HK...

“There it is.” You smiled, hoping it was the right one. Pikachu’s were rare and it wasn’t like you expected to see a bunch. You flew off after it to see what it was doing.
1551211122232.title: Head to the forest to avoid confrontation.

choices: Your Phone rings, letting you know mission complete.
Pikachu lets you fuse with it for a bit as thanks.
15512111222321.content:
Your eyes widened as you saw what was chasing the Pikachu.

It looked like a Pikachu, but far from it. First, instead of yellow, it was black and white. Like if you compared the original Gameboy games to the current color ones. It was fuzzy too, like a badly tuned TV set. As it ran, it sort of flickered in and out of the area, back and forth. Not quite teleporting, but could be confused with it. There was no way around it and you dove down to help out.

That was the glitch.

Dropping your bag on a tree branch, you flew over the Pikachu and the glitch to get into position. The glitch was catching up and up ahead you noticed a cliff face up ahead that was going to stop Pikachu from escaping. You didn’t have much time. The Pikachu slid to a stop and realized what was happening and turned around to face it’s attackers. Sparks shot out of its cheeks as it prepared to fight.

The Glitch shot it’s only lightning at it and you realized being fused with a flying type, you were weak to electricity.

Not like you had time to do anything else though.

You dove down above Pikachu and flapped your wings aggressively. Wind formed as you made your first Gust attack. The mini tornado flew forward and collided with the glitch, sending it flying back. The Pikachu looked up at you in surprise, never seeing something like you before. Before you could tell it anything, lightning flew from the glitch at you. Somehow your reflexes moved you out of the way in time, barely.

“Run!” You yelled at Pikachu. “It’s after you!”

More lightning flew at you from the glitch and you were forced to fly up to dodge. The Pikachu looked like it wanted to listen, but shook it’s head. Electricity began to spark from its cheeks and then fired a blast at the glitch. It made direct contact and briefly stunned it. This gave you the chance to fire another Gust. The glitch was lifted into the air and slammed into a tree.

The creature flickered, like it was fading away, before vanishing.

You land on the ground and look at Pikachu. It was watching you wearily. Sighing, you called on your power and defused from the Pidgey.

“Looks like my job is done,” You tell Pidgey, as Pikachu watched. “I’ll have to leave soon.” Pidgey cawed and tilted it’s head. “I don’t think you can come. It will be lonely. I’m glad I met you. You helped me save this Pikachu. Thanks for letting me fuse with you for the time being.”

Pikachu and Pidgey were both staring at you. You couldn’t take Pikachu, since the quest required it to be saved. Pidgey would be lonely in your home base, with no other Pokémon.
15512111222321.title: Pikachu was being chased.

choices: One of the other guys talks to you a bit.
You decide to stay and check out more Pokemon.
155121112223211.content:
Your Phone rings and you looked down at it.

Mission Complete:
When you are ready to leave, you may return to the base of your choice and from there, your reward will be given. One skill of your choice will be leveled and you will have the ability to travel to a world of your choice to receive your first harem girl.

Bonus: For efficiency clearing your first world, you will receive an item to help you get your first girl. The item depends on which world you want to join.

“Sweet!” You cheered as Pikachu and Pidgey stared at you. “I’m done!”

Then you heard shouting.

You turned around and heard some people coming toward you. They had to be people as you could make out some words. You gestured for Pikachu and Pidgey to leave, which they did mere moments before the others arrived. One of the three men was the hiker you saw in your harpy form.

Luckily, it didn’t look like he recognized you.

“Lad!” He said to you. “Have you seen anything strange around here?”

“Er… no?” You lied. “I’ve just been out walking around and playing with some of the Pokémon.”

“Nothing?” The second guy asked. “Nothing that seemed to be dangerous?”

“Like some Beedrills?” You asked, still feigning ignorance.

“No, like a human Pokémon hybrid that attacks people!” The hiker told you gruffly.

“Huh?” You didn’t attack him at all. “Have you… been hitting the bottle a little too hard?”

The guy’s face grew red as the other two guys were trying not to laugh. He marched off, muttering about monsters as you debated if you wanted to leave and get your rewards.
155121112223211.title: Your Phone rings, letting you know mission comp...

1551211122232111.content:
Today was your first successful day as a Worldwalker, and you figured it would be for the best if you called it in for the day. You will always have more time to come back for the women of this world.

You texted Trucker-Buddha that you were ready to leave, and a portal opened taking you to gm_chata https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/f... one of the first worlds granted to you as a place of rest. This forested Gary's Mod map always did give off creepy vibes to you, but at the same time it had its own comfy feeling.

As you walked further through the area you joked to yourself about this place would be perfect for something scary like a pack of fleshgaits to attack you. But you're certain such creatures don't exist here. What you do want to know is if food exists in one of the houses.
1551211122232111.title: Leave the world.

1551211122232113.content:
You had plenty of time before leaving the pokemon world for one of your new pads. Why miss a golden opportunity to explore one of the worlds you loved watching as a kid? You are going to enjoy looking at some more pokemon with your own eyes.

What pokemon comes up on your radar?
1551211122232113.title: You decide to stay and check out more Pokemon.

choices: Book it to the Mushroom Kingdom
15512112.content:
You walk in a set of woods in the first world Trucker-Buddha sent you to, curious as to what sort of world you're in. It appears to be peaceful, serene, but looks can be very deceiving. Also feels incredibly familiar for some reason you cannot quite explain. Something inside of you is saying you know this world, but you cannot put your finger on it. Then you saw it.

You see a yellow brick block with a white question marks in the center on each side floating in the air. It was at that moment you knew where you're at. You're in the Super Mario universe.

"He did say this was a simple world after all," you say musing on Trucker-Buddha's words before you entered this world.

You believe you can handle this. It's the Mario universe. You'll probably end up karting with Bowser and Mario by the end of this. That's when another idea pops into your head. You could kidnap Princess Peach before the Koppa King himself does to show how princess kidnapping is really done. Or you could convince Peach to come with you when this is done and leave the copy of her to deal with being kidnapped over and over again. Whatever comes first.
15512112.title: Mario

choices: Where do you go from here now?
15512113.content:
Your face bore an expression of deep concern when you saw the world before you. Men wearing a drab uniform desperately fighting against hulking green brutes You have seen this scene playout at least a few dozen times. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JW1Yc9OR...

You are in the Warhammer 40k universe, the lovely setting that gave the world the word "grimdark". More specifically you're on the planet Tartarus where the first Dawn of War game took place. You like the setting and the many factions from the Imperium of Man to the Necrons, but you are greatly aware of the many awful and painful ways that you can die here. However, since not all of the factions are here your ways of death are limited to the Orks killing you for fun, the Imperials thinking you're a heretic and killing you, the Eldar killing you because they find your life, and well most human life in general, to be less than one of their own, or the Chaos Space Marines and cultists here torturing you for fun and to appease the Ruinous Powers. And the last part still leads to you being tortured by daemons for all eternity.

You believe yourself to not to be ready for this setting yet. If it wasn't for your phone vibrating you wouldn't have known it was ringing over the sounds of guns and dying from afar.

"Anon, I am sorry for this. You have my deepest apologies," said Trucker-Buddha from the other side. "This is not the original world I intended to you too."

"Well gee thanks!" you reply trying your hardest to not sound insincere as a stray Ork bullet nearly struck you. Ork aiming truly is awful you thought to yourself. "So what happened?"

"An unseen hand interfered and stuck its fingers in the portal." Explained the trucker Fabius.

Before you could ask who or what could have possibly done that you heard an ungodly screeching chorus of multiple voices in an array of tones that shouldn't exist on the phone line. "̷̸̳̙̞͙JÚ̠͖̥̣̼̲̤͂ͤ̈̉͐̈S̥̖̱͔͈͋̉̈́ͫͩT ̆̐̋͌͑ͤ̓̎͌͋̚Aͪ͘͏̵̣S̪̝͈̘̦̖̮̋ͮ̍͒͊̑̈̚ͅ ͚̓́͡P̡̧͋̅ͦͭ̚Ĺ̼̰̲̣͌̍ͣȦ̙N͌̇͂ͥͬͫ̅N͏Eͤ͌ͨ̓ͤ̓ͧ̓ ̵̤͚͚̺͔̗̜̫̯̻͔ͨͬ̎́͢ͅD̍̌ͩ͛͂̀͒͌̓̾͏̡̘̘͍̻͕̮͙̫ͅÍ ™.̸̭̲̂̀̚"̨̿ͮ͊̃́͆͐ͨ̑

Motherfugging Tzeentch. The Father of Lies, the Architect of Fate, patron Chaos God of the Thousand Sons, and what amounts to the god of hope for this fugged up setting is dicking you over right now to get one of his everchanging infinite schemes rolling. Or just because he's bored. Probably both.

Surprisingly, hearing the voice of a Chaos God over your phone didn't utterly destroy your sanity. "So, Trucker-Buddha," you say around the time Colonel Carus Brom executed the men fleeing for their lives as you've seen already dozens of times before, "Can you get me out of here?"

You expected the worst and were still disappointed when he said in return, "No I cannot. Once I send you to a world you must slay the glitches present before leaving."

"I thought you said I would be able to travel to any world I wanted to."

"Yes, but only when you have completed enough of the tasks laid down by my master and I to be free of our contract."

You rolled your eyes and groaned under your breath.

"I will compensate you for this ordeal. Instead of taking one woman from this universe you may make off with two."

You guessed that would have to do. Though your recruitment pool for harem girls is going to be limited on this planet. Most of the inhabitants here are dead or will die soon. Then again, there is one lady you remember from this you could try your hand at. Farseer Macha. You don't really see how you're going to convince Macha to come back with you, or know how you can capture a psychic space elf who's job is to see into the future but you'll figure it out eventually. Fug it, you're also going to bag one of those Howling Banshees too. You know good and well why they're popular for reasons other than how they perform on the tabletop game.

At this time, the Blood Ravens' drop pods descend and you observe good old Gabriel Angelos lead his battle-brothers into combat against the orks, saving the remaining Imperial Guardsmen from grizzly deaths.
15512113.title: It was another familiar world

choices: Risk it and go off on your own
155121131.content:
You quickly hide yourself behind some rubble as guardsmen march by leaving you to plan ahead your next move. This isn't like playing the Dawn of War game where if you die you can spend some requisition and energy points to respawn. Death from anything to chainsaw swords to mindbullets are a very real possibility. How far your gifts of absorption and fusing can take you at their current levels is yet to be determined, but you can always try grabbing a gun a regular human can use. Space Marine bolters and other weapons are far too large for regular humans to use, and you highly doubt you can use a chainsword meant for a marine.

You think you can take on small things here such as a guardsman, chaos cultist, and lowly gretchin without too much trouble. Space marine scouts will probably knock you on the floor. But trained genetically engineered super soldiers wearing power armor that at least weighs a ton, centuries old space elf soldiers with better reflexes than you, walking and talking fungus with bat attitudes, the former's evil and spikey counterparts, and daemons are probably out of the question. Well, maybe not all the daemons. You sure as heck won't try your luck at taking on the Bloodthirster that eventually comes up.

Which leads you to a much bigger problem in hindsight. Sindri Myr. You know for a fact you can't take on that heartless bastard with the way you are now even if he's not a daemon prince yet. He'll flay you alive and rip your soul out to make daemon chow if you tried crossing him.

Of course you can do the most obvious thing for a person with knowledge of the 40k universe can do in your position can do. Follow Gabriel and tell him about Sindri and the Alpha Legion here. If he doesn't believe, you can get Isador to read your mind and that will solve it. Heck, you can prevent Isador from being corrupted by Sindri, and warn the both of them about Kyras being a follower of Chaos too. You'll save the Blood Ravens from wasting hundreds of their lives by invalidating a chunk of the DoW series' storyline(looking at you Boreale).

But that might lead this to become a seperate timeline though? You shrugged remembering the policy of what is and what isn't canon in 40k.

Option #1: You decide that it's better if you go off on your own knowing the risks. Gather some supplies, practice your absorption gift, and head out to find the glitch.

Option #2: Follow Captain Angelos and warn him of everything

Option #3: Your entry into this universe has coated you in some energy that has not gone unnoticed by certain individuals of the knife-eared variety. They want to have a chat with you.
155121131.title: Where do you go from here now?

1551212.content:
With a seemingly endless pool of powers for you to pick this is somewhat overwhelming. You don't believe that your host will allow you select something overpowered, and you also want to stray from choosing something too simple. Like mind reading or just being a wizard. You can easily pick those powers up in some of the worlds you will find yourself in. Trucker-Buddha merely waits for you to come up with your final gift. You are not the first new Worldwalker to find himself in this position, and you most definitely will not be the last. Thankfully for him, he has all the time possible to wait.

While deep in thought the memory of the comments of a certain rapper about a certain president emerge bring with them an idea.

Oh yeah I can make that work.

You turn your attention to Trucker-Buddha who was drinking a glass of cold sweet tea while you were busy thinking. From the look in your eyes he gathered you finally came up with an idea. You told him about it, and the heavenly trucker prince nodded affirmatively over it. This idea of your was indeed something he could grant.

A wide tv screen appeared over the table and the following words showed up.

STATUS: Anon
Health: 125
Mana: 125

Final gift: DRAGON ENERGY

Dragon Energy(Phase One): This is your default phase. You will always posse enhanced physical strength and senses above a regular human man in addition to pyrokinetic magic.

Dragon Energy(Phase Two): You will gain the form of half man and half dragon for a set amount of time. Your default abilities will be increased further, you gain protective scales, and the ability to fly.

"Yes." You said confirming this is what you want. You strength, mobility, and to get a start at magic. You were going to go with something like that American Dragon cartoon that once came on, but you did not desire becoming a man sized dragon. You know for a fact that it would get you killed in certain settings.

A warm glow covers you as your new strength buffs your body, something you find oddly pleasurable. Soon a vortex of fire surrounds your feet and soon consumes you whole. Once the fire subsides you take a look at your phase two form. You're still you but with golden scales with red coloration at the ends cover you mostly from head to toe, at the ends of your hands are sharp menacing claws, a medium length tail emerges from the base of your spine, and a set of wings capable of allowing you to take off come from your upper back.

Trucker-Buddha rise up and extends his arms long and wide. "Now, Anon. Show me your dragon energy!"

You understood completely what he meant. Normally you wouldn't do this sort of thing to anyone who asks, but you doubt you'll be able to harm an otherworldly being such as him. You inhaled deeply, and exhaled a gout of flame that enveloped Trucker-Buddha whole. Once you were done you saw that you incinerated his glass of tea and table to ash. Whoops.

"Excellent!" You heard from the pillar of flame that disappeared with an unharmed Trucker-Buddha as you expected. "You were right to pick this gift."

You smiled from his praise only to be overcome with a sense of weakness. You fall down on your back and to your confusion return to normal. You look up at a new tv screen to see your status.

STATUS: Anon
Health: 125
Mana: 15

"This gift while a powerful one is however very taxing you see." Explains Trucker-Buddha. "Your second phase will drain you very quickly as you are now. With time you will be able to overcome this. Try to use your fire magic now."

You did as he said, and after several degrees of failure you manage to conjure up only a measly apple-sized fireball. "Anything else I need to know?" He then explains to you that any weapon or spell that is extremely effective on dragons will harm you just the same in your second phase. You will keep that in mind.

"And one more thing, Anon. I know you are undoubtedly ready to begin your new life and to snatch up as many women as you can," he says while you shrugged as if you had no idea what he was talking about, "You must also know that with every glitch slain you gain enough energy to take one girl with you back just as it does with allowing you to exit the world. A replica will take her place to keep said universe from being unbalanced in most circumstances."

You raise your eyebrows in curiosity over that. "What do you mean by that?"

"When a character has played their part and is no longer mentioned in the next story does the plot matter if they fade into obscurity?"

When you think about it like that it sounds less cold than it did at first.

"And then there are worlds that are just destined for destruction. As we speak right now many worlds are being destroyed by a multitude of things ranging from evil gods, the natural course of things, and rituals being performed in dark places. You may take at least 15 girls from these worlds if you visit them at their time of doom."

He snaps his fingers and you have a feeling of being refreshed as your mana is restored to its peak. "Take this," he says as a cellphone manifests in your hand. "We will keep in contact this way."

What world do you go to for your first job?
1551212.title: Dragon Energy

info.brief_description: You get isekai'd into a fictional world. What happens next is up to you.
info.description:
You go about your business as you always do until one fateful day the Lord of all Trucks, Truck-Kun, decided that you are to be sent to a fictional world forcibly in the typical manner an isekai protagonist is sent to another world. After that it's all up to you what you do. You can flip the script entirely with your knowledge of the world you're sent to. Turn the female cast into your harem if you wish it. Do you want to beat both the good guys and bad guys and be the boss of the world you're sent to? Sure go ahead.

Rule 1: Your name shall be "Anon" because writing "*Your Name* all the time is the big gay.
Rule 2: Proper spelling and grammar would be appreciated.
Rule 3: No futa, furries, toilet stuff, anthros, gay sex, weight gain, diaper stuff, vore or anything else that's gross.
Rule 4: Depending on the setting you may assume the role of the mc in games such as Skyrim.
Rule 5: Sex is fine, but at least have smut with a plot.
Rule 6: Drugs are bad, m'kay? Things like the types of serums that have been used in my stories? Go ahead.
Rule 7: No one sentence chapters.
Rule 8: Depending on the setting you will gain powers native to that setting.
Rule 9: Be creative
Rule 10: Have fun.
